intro: Alsine dillenii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and tiny, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has a mat-forming growth habit, which helps it conserve moisture and protect against wind erosion. Alsine dillenii is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields.
